subsection_name: protein-nieu.json_3_What factors increase the risk of protein in urine?
subsection_content:
Anyone can develop proteinuria, but the following risk groups often have higher rates: (3)
Older people (this group is often dehydrated and has kidney problems).; People who get pregnant after 40 years old; People with high blood pressure; People with diabetes.; People with a family history of kidney disease or pre-eclampsia; People who are overweight or obese.
subsection_title: protein nieu.json. What factors increase the risk of protein in urine?
subsection_data:
protein nieu.json. What factors increase the risk of protein in urine?
Anyone can develop proteinuria, but the following risk groups often have higher rates: (3)
Older people (this group is often dehydrated and has kidney problems).; People who get pregnant after 40 years old; People with high blood pressure; People with diabetes.; People with a family history of kidney disease or pre-eclampsia; People who are overweight or obese.
